title: Cisco Umbrella
descriptionMarkdown: The Cisco Umbrella data connector provides the capability to ingest information about your Cisco Umbrella events stored in Amazon S3 into Azure Sentinel through the Amazon S3 REST API. [See documentation.](https://docs.umbrella.com/deployment-umbrella/docs/log-management)

dataTypes.name: Cisco_Umbrella_dns_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Cisco_Umbrella_dns_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Cisco_Umbrella_proxy_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Cisco_Umbrella_proxy_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Cisco_Umbrella_ip_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Cisco_Umbrella_ip_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: Cisco_Umbrella_cloudfirewall_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
Cisco_Umbrella_cloudfirewall_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
Cisco_Umbrella_dns_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(1d)

Cisco_Umbrella_proxy_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(1d)

Cisco_Umbrella_ip_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(1d)

Cisco_Umbrella_cloudfirewall_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(1d)

instructionSteps.description: >**NOTE:** This connector uses Azure Functions to connect to the Amazon S3 REST API to pull logs into Azure Sentinel. This might result in additional data ingestion costs. Check the [Azure Functions pricing page](https://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/details/functions/) for details.

>**(Optional Step)** Securely store workspace and API authorization key(s) or token(s) in Azure Key Vault. Azure Key Vault provides a secure mechanism to store and retrieve key values. [Follow these instructions](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/app-service/app-service-key-vault-references) to use Azure Key Vault with an Azure Function App.

**STEP 1 - Configuration of the Cisco Umbrella logs collection**

[See documentation](https://docs.umbrella.com/deployment-umbrella/docs/log-management#section-logging-to-amazon-s-3) and follow the instructions for set up logging and obtain credentials.

**STEP 2 - Choose ONE from the following two deployment options to deploy the connector and the associated Azure Function**

>**IMPORTANT:** Before deploying the Cisco Umbrella data connector, have the Workspace ID and Workspace Primary Key (can be copied from the following), as well as the Amazon S3 REST API Authorization credentials, readily available.

instructionSteps.title: Option 1 - Azure Resource Manager (ARM) Template
instructionSteps.description:
Use this method for automated deployment of the Cisco Umbrella data connector using an ARM Tempate.

1. Click the **Deploy to Azure** button below. 

	[![Deploy To Azure](https://aka.ms/deploytoazurebutton)](https://aka.ms/sentinelciscoumbrellaazuredeploy)
2. Select the preferred **Subscription**, **Resource Group** and **Location**. 
3. Enter the **Workspace ID**, **Workspace Key**, **S3Bucket**, **AWSAccessKeyId**, **AWSSecretAccesKey**, **AWSRegionName** and deploy.

instructionSteps.title: Option 2 - Manual Deployment of Azure Functions (Deploy via VS Code)
instructionSteps.description: Use the following step-by-step instructions to deploy the Cisco Umbrella connector manually with Azure Functions.

**1. Deploy a Function App via VS Code**

> NOTE:You will need to prepare VS code for Azure function development. See [link](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-functions/functions-create-first-function-powershell#prerequisites)

1. Download the [Zip file](https://github.com/socprime/Azure-Sentinel/DataConnectors/CiscoUmbrella/blob/CiscoUmbrellaConnector/CiscoUmbrellaConn.zip?raw=true) of the Azure Funciton app from Github.
2. Extract to a location on your local host.
3. Open VS Code.
4. Click File -> Open Folder.
5. Select the top level folder from extracted files.
6. Click Azure Functions: Deploy to function app. You maybe asked to sign in to Azure.
7. Click Create New function app in Azure (advanced).
8. Provide a unique name like "Umbrellaxxx". Press Enter.
9. Select runtime stack: Python 3.8.
10. Hosting plan: click Consumption.
11. Click Create new Resource Group or select existing.
12. Click Create a new storage Account or select existing.
13. Click Create new Application Insights resource.
14. Pick a location to deploy in.
15. Deployment will begin.
16. Wait for the deployment to complete.
17. Go to the Azure Portal.

**2. Configure the Function App**

1. In the Function App, select the Function App Name and select **Configuration**.
2. In the **Application settings** tab, select **+ New application setting**.
3. Add each of the following application settings individually, with their respective string values (case-sensitive): 
		WorkspaceID
		WorkspaceKey
		S3Bucket
		AWSAccessKeyId
		AWSSecretAccesKey
		AWSRegionName
3. Once all application settings have been entered, click **Save**.

>**NOTE:** This connector uses a parser based on a Kusto Function to normalize fields. [Follow these steps](https://github.com/socprime/Azure-Sentinel/Parsers/CiscoUmbrella/blob/CiscoUmbrellaConnector/Cisco_Umbrella_func?raw=true) to create the Kusto function alias Cisco_Umbrella_func.
